thread.title: UPDATE 1-Petrobras strike cuts output at offshore oil platform -union
thread.title_full: UPDATE 1-Petrobras strike cuts output at offshore oil platform -union | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: UPDATE 1-Petrobras strike cuts output at offshore oil platform -union
text:
(Adds size of cut output compared with total Petrobras output, last paragraph)
RIO DE JANEIRO, July 24 (Reuters) - A 24-hour strike at Brazil's state-run oil producer Petroleo Brasileiro SA has resulted in an output cut at one of 19 offshore oil and gas platforms where workers laid down their tools earlier on Friday, a union involved in the action told Reuters.
The strike managed to shut output from the P-15 offshore production platform in the Campos Basin northeast of Rio de Janeiro, said SindepetroNF, a union that represents platform workers.
In May, the P-15, a semi-submersible vessel, produced 2,479 barrels per day of petroleum and 458,440 cubic meters of natural gas a day from the Marimb√° and Pirauna fields, both 100 percent owned by Petrobras, as the oil company is known.
In May, output from the P-15 was about one-tenth of 1 percent of Petrobras' total Brazilian output of 2.61 million barrels of oil and equivalent natural gas a day.
Petrobras could not immediately be reached for comment. (Reporting by Marta Nogueira and Jeb Blount; Editing by G Crosse and Matthew Lewis )
